content: instagram @stoncusknit mini scarf pearl by stoncusknit veronika stoncus gauge 10x10 cm = 20 stitches x 24 row the sample is knitted in double moss stitch as shown in the chart on the page 3 use size 4 needles i recommend circular needles with an 80 cm cord but double-pointed needles can also be used see chart a size one size / length 140 cm before washing 112 cm using drops air yarn / width 12 cm p s the length after washing may vary when using diserent yarn yarn drops air 65% alpaca 28% polyamide 7% wool 50 g/150 m you will need 50 g for this project p s if you plan to use a diserent yarn you may need slightly more drops air is very light and airy which is why the required amount is so small additional materials needed circular needles size 4 i recommend a 60/80 cm cord scissors measuring tape row counter tapestry needle with a rounded tip two markers abbreviations st s stitch es k - knit p - purl row sl1 - slip one stitch without knitting m1 - make 1 by creating a yarn over with the working yarn toward the back the loop points to the right see the video https //youtu be/yzafwiqcgyw purl last st always purl the last stitch at the end of each row k2tog knit two stitches together with a right-leaning decrease video with all information about the scarf in latvian language https //youtu be/uvccr4unafm 1 author veronika stončus / stoncusknit this description is for personal use only all intellectual property rights pdf file video and photos belong to the author v stončus copying and distributing the description without the author s written consent is prohibited 2024 instagram @stoncusknit using needles size 4 us size 6 cast on 4 stitches refer to chart b row 1 sl1 p k purl the last stitch recommend marking this side with a marker for easier tracking row 2 sl1 p k purl the last stitch row 3 sl1 k p purl the last stitch row 4 sl1 m1 k p purl the last stitch row 5 sl1 p k p purl the last stitch row 6 sl1 m1 k p k purl the last stitch row 7 sl1 k p k p purl the last stitch row 8 sl1 m1 k p k p purl the last stitch row 9 sl1 p k p l p purl the last stitch row 10 sl1 m1 k p k p k purl the last stitch increasing stitches continue in this manner increasing 1 stitch every second row repeat the increases 16 more times until you have a total of 24 stitches on the needles length and pattern following knit back and forth in row following chart a for a total of 219 row approximately 80 cm binding oy set a new reference point for the bind-os row 1 sl1 work 20 stitches following the pattern k2tog purl the last stitch row
